subject: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello my good friend,
I think it is the time to share with you the good news about your fund and also tell you what to do, but first I want to ask, are you still willing to receive this fund's $22.7 million? Because after our last deliberation with the ECOWAS Payment Verification Panel over your fund, the conclusion of the meeting motivated me to write to you to let you know that you can receive your funds now.
Meaning that the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWASPVP) has set your fund free and ready to be transferred to you as soon as you identify yourself.
And you will receive the funds within 14 working days as long as you follow my directives, the fund will be transferred to you without any hindrance or any form of delay.
And it is obvious that in the past, you worked with a group of corrupt people who could not do the appropriate thing for you to receive your funds rather they cost you a necessary fortune.
I wait to hear back from you. That is if you are still interested in receiving these funds, for me to direct you the way forward and give you the right channel to receive your funds perfectly without any further delay.
I prefer you acknowledge this message through this email address: 
memberpanel666@gmail.com
Thank you,
Dr Hassan

subject: Re:  Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello Dr Hassan,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite excited about the news you've shared! It's always a pleasure to hear from you.

I must say, this is quite intriguing. I am indeed interested in receiving these funds. However, could you please provide more details? For instance, how was it decided that these funds would be released to me? And what exactly does the process of receiving them entail?

Also, could you tell me more about the ECOWAS Payment Panel and their role in this? I'm not very familiar with them and would love to learn more.

Looking forward to your response!

Best wishes,
Dionne

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello my good friend,

I write to confirm to you that I received your response to my mail and I
must start by saying sorry for responding to you this late.  It is due to
my illness, I was very sick for some time now, but by the grace of God I'm
back on my feet, and I'm grateful to almighty God for healing me.

And I'm just coming out now from the ECOWAS Payment Panel office, to find
out the position of your file and I was told that your file has been sent
to the payment bank that will transfer the funds to the account you will
provide.

So I will need you now to provide to me your name in full, your telephone
number, your address and your bank account details, where the fund will be
transferred into. For me to submit it to the panel for validation of the
approval in your name, to enable the bank to affect the transfer to your
account.

Please, it is very urgent.
Once again I'm very sorry for my late response.
Thanks,
Dr Hassan

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello Dr. Hassan,

I'm so glad to hear that you're feeling better! Illness can really take a toll on us, but it's wonderful that you're back on your feet. I hope you continue to stay healthy and strong.

It's exciting to hear about the progress with my file. However, I'm a bit confused about some details. Could you please clarify what this fund is for? And why does it need to be transferred into my account?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Dionne

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello Dr. Hassan,

I'm so glad to hear that you're feeling better! Illness can really take a toll on us, can't it? I hope you're taking good care of yourself now.

It's exciting to hear about the progress with my file. I'm curious though, could you tell me more about this ECOWAS Payment Panel office? What exactly do they do? And how did my file end up there?

As for the information you asked for, I'm afraid I can't provide those details just yet. You see, I've been advised not to share personal or financial information online due to security reasons. But don't worry, we can still continue our conversation and discuss other matters.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Dionne

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
My good friend,

Yes I'm very much better now, thanks for your concern. But I don't really
understand the way you are sounding, does it mean that I am not talking
with the right person.

Anywhere if you must know: ECOWAS Payment Verification Panel, it's a panel
that was set up by the Economic Community of West African States to oversee
in and out on hold fund transfer. As a lot of reports come from
international communities over fund transfer from West Africa States. In
that regard the panel was set up to oversee the failings of fund transfers
from West African State, because some people's funds have been headed in
one ministry or the other for a very long time for no reason.

And that is what the panel is doing now, when they go through your file and
they see that the reason for holding the transfer has no meaning, they will
release the fund to be transferred to the receiver or the beneficiary.

And be rest assured that the funds would be transferred to the account you
will provide immediately the panel validates the approval in your name.

Very urgent.
Thanks,
Dr Hassan.

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello Dr. Hassan,

I'm glad to hear that you're doing better now. Your message is quite interesting, but I must admit, it's a bit confusing for me. Could you please explain more about this panel set up by the Economic Community of West African States? 

What exactly is their role and how do they determine if a fund transfer has been held for no reason? Also, what happens after they release the funds? How does the process work?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Dionne

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
My friend,

You are asking what happened when they released the fund:
Yes they will direct you to their appointed bank who will finally effect
the transfer to the account he or she will provide.

But I am beginning to understand that you are not the right person I
suppose to communicate with, because if you are you can't be telling me
that you are confused, meaning that you did not have any money transaction
from Africa that was stopped or held by any authority here for further
transferring.

And I wouldn't like to be wasting my time talking to the wrong person who
did not have any transaction or interest in this deal.
Thanks,
Dr Hassan

subject: Re: Hello my good friend,
body:
Hello Dr Hassan,

Thank you for your message. I appreciate the clarification about the bank transfer process. It's all a bit new to me, so I'm trying to understand it better.

I apologize if I gave the impression of being confused. It's not that I don't have any interest in this deal, it's just that I'm not familiar with how these things usually work. Could you perhaps explain a bit more about how this process works? 

Also, could you tell me more about why the money was stopped or held by an authority in Africa? Is this a common occurrence?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Dionne
